dc:title: On Pilgrimage - June 1951
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Describes visiting the Tombs prison, the waiting, noise, anger. Berates herself for getting angry at guests who are a trial. Asks how to blend charity and the common good. Finally says "the secret is to take what comes."
